resources.string: Submit SMS to Gmail over the internet.
Maximum of %1$d items per submission reached. Restart submission to continue.
There were no items to submit.

plurals.name: status_done_details
plurals.item: Successfully submitted %1$d item.\nNow go to the draft-folder of your Gmail account!
Successfully submitted %1$d items.\nNow go to the draft-folder of your Gmail account!

resources.string: Please make sure you enabled IMAP in your Gmail account settings and check your username and password.
Unable to connect to the Internet, please check the network.
Please change the language of your Gmail to English, then submit again.
WARNING: Changing the username will reset all your submission information and your password.
The password is stored on this device and is only used to login at Gmail.
Sumitted SMS messages will be tagged with this label in Gmail.
Maximum number of items per submission.
Whether to mark messages in Gmail as read or not.
Whether to automatically submit new sent SMS or not.
You need to set the login information before submission.
Submission data has been reset. Please set your password and perform a manual submit. You will be able to decide whether to submit or skip messages stored on this device.
The label name may only contain unaccented letters (A-Z, a-z).

Submit or skip all messages currently stored on this device?

Note: If you choose to submit, all messages will submit in one batch. 
If you choose to skip, all messages currently stored on your device are simply marked as submitted and can not be submitted again.
The first submission needs to be initiated manually. Would you like to perform a submission now?
Internal error: First submission without indication whether to skip messages or not.

You can now submit all SMS messages on your Android device to Gmail!
Check out the SMS Collection application by clicking the following link on your device:
%1$s
or visit:
%2$s
The full Gmail address should end with @gmail.com

Dear %1$s:

Thank you for participating in our project!

We would like to collect the %2$d messages below for research.To do so, we need you to send out this draft email to us so that we can collect the messages for the public corpus.

We realize that SMS often contain sensitive data. As such, to protect your privacy, we’ve tried to anonymize any sensitive data in your SMSes, such as telephone numbers, email addresses and other potentially sensitive information. This anonymization process was done on your android device so that your personal SMSes have not yet been sent to our server. Despite this process, you may want to review the messages below to delete any SMSes that you would not like to provide to us for our public research corpus. If you would like to remove any such messages, please simply delete the text of each corresponding message between the two separator lines (----------) in this email (please do leave the line with the SMS metadata if you don’t mind).Once you are satisfied with your submission, please send out this email.

The unique code to identify your submission is:%3$s , which will be used to correctly correlate your task and your email thus credit you for your work.

Again, your %2$d messages have not yet been collected. We need you to send this email out to us both to collect the messages as well as to act as consent to collect these for linguistic research.

If you want to know more about our project, please refer to our project home page: http://wing.comp.nus.edu.sg:8080/SMSCorpus

Thank you very much!

Tao Chen and A/P Min-Yen Kan
 Web IR / NLP Group (@ National University of Singapore)

%2$d messages follow:
%4$s
